examples.note: The container component is also supported in case your theme doesn't include a container.
The container-fluid component is supported as a discrete shortcode.

parameters.name: xs
parameters.description: Size of column on extra small screens.

parameters.name: sm
parameters.description: Size of column on small screens.

parameters.name: md
parameters.description: Size of column on medium screens.

parameters.name: lg
parameters.description: Size of column on large screens.

parameters.name: xl
parameters.description: Size of column on extra large screens.

parameters.name: offset_xs
parameters.description: Offset on extra small screens.

parameters.name: offset_sm
parameters.description: Offset on small screens.

parameters.name: offset_md
parameters.description: Offset on medium screens.

parameters.name: offset_lg
parameters.description: Offset on large screens.

parameters.name: offset_xl
parameters.description: Offset on extra large screens.

parameters.name: pull_xs
parameters.description: Pull on extra small screens.

parameters.name: pull_sm
parameters.description: Pull on small screens.

parameters.name: pull_md
parameters.description: Pull on medium screens.

parameters.name: pull_lg
parameters.description: Pull on large screens.

parameters.name: pull_xl
parameters.description: Pull on extra large screens.

parameters.name: push_xs
parameters.description: Push on extra small screens.

parameters.name: push_sm
parameters.description: Push on small screens.

parameters.name: push_md
parameters.description: Push on medium screens.

parameters.name: push_lg
parameters.description: Push on large screens.

parameters.name: push_xl
parameters.description: Push on extra large screens.

examples.note: Wrap several [media-object]s in [media-list], useful for comment threads or articles lists.

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Whether the image pulls to the left or right.

shortcodes.name: media-heading
shortcodes.note: [media-heading] should contain heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a header tag is not added h4 will be inserted automatically.

parameters.name: up
parameters.description: Hide the contents on this screen size and above.

parameters.name: down
parameters.description: Hide the contents on this screen size and below.

items.title: Alerts
items.note: Any links, headings, or strong or bold text within an alert will automatically be styled to match the alert type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the alert.

parameters.name: dismissible
parameters.description: If the alert should be dismissable.

examples.note: Remember that [breadcrumb] must wrap a set of links inserted via the WordPress editor.

items.title: Buttons
items.note: Wrap any a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor in [button] to give it button properties and classes.

examples.note: Set button sizes with the size parameter.
Set block flag for block-style buttons.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the button.
parameters.values: primary, secondary, success, info, warning, danger, link, outline-primary, outline-secondary, outline-success, outline-info, outline-warning, outline-danger

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the button.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: Flag whether the button should be a block-level button.

items.title: Button Groups
items.note: Remember that [button] must wrap an a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor.

examples.code: [button-group] [button type="secondary"] [active]Text[/active] [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [/button-group]

examples.note: Set the vertical flag to make the buttons appear vertically stacked rather than horiztonally.
examples.code: [button-group vertical] [button type="secondary"] [active]Text[/active] [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [/button-group]

examples.note: Wrap [button group]s in [button-toolbar] to make a button toolbar.
examples.code: [button-toolbar] [button-group] [button type="secondary"] [active]Text[/active] [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [/button-group] [button-group] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [button type="secondary"] Text [/button] [/button-group] [button-group] [button type="secondary"] [disabled]Text[/disabled] [/button] [/button-group] [/button-toolbar]

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the button.

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.description: Flag whether the button is vertical.

examples.note: Image caps are supported with the [card-img] shortcode and the top or bottom flag.
Image overlay cards are supported with the [card-img-overlay] shortcode.
Card header and card footers are supported with the [card-header] and [card-footer] shortcodes.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Contextual background color for the card.
parameters.values: primary, secondary, success, info, warning, danger, link, outline-primary, outline-secondary, outline-success, outline-info, outline-warning, outline-danger

parameters.name: inverse
parameters.description: Flag whether to invert the text color for contextual backgrounds.

shortcodes.name: card-block
shortcodes.note: Any p or blockquote tags within [card-block] will automatically receive card-text or card-blockquote classes respectively

shortcodes.name: card-title
shortcodes.note: [card-title] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added h4 will be inserted automatically

shortcodes.name: card-subtitle
shortcodes.note: [card-subtitle] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added h6 will be inserted automatically

shortcodes.name: card-img
shortcodes.note: [card-img] should contain an image inserted using the WordPress editor.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Flag whether this image cap is at the top of the card.

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.description: Flag whether this image cap is at the bottom of the card.

shortcodes.name: card-header
shortcodes.note: [card-header] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added div (no heading) will be inserted automatically

items.title: Carousel
items.note: Remember that [carousel] must wrap a set of images inserted via the WordPress editor.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The amount of time to delay between automatically cycling an item. If false, carousel will not automatically cycle.

parameters.name: pause
parameters.description: Whether the carousel pauses on hover. If set to null, hovering over the carousel won't pause it.

parameters.name: wrap
parameters.description: Whether the carousel should cycle continuously or have hard stops.

examples.note: Create an accordion by wrapping [card]s in [accordion].

items.title: Dropdowns
items.note: Remember that [dropdown-menu] must wrap an a, or button tags inserted via the WordPress editor.

examples.note: The dropdown flag must be used on a [button] shortcode for dropdowns to work.
Add a header to label sections of actions in any dropdown menu.
examples.description: Dropdown with header tags as labels
examples.code:
[dropdown] [button dropdown]Dropdown Button[/button] [dropdown-menu]
Dropdown header
Link 1 Link 2 Link 3 [/dropdown-menu] [/dropdown]

examples.note: Separate groups of related menu items with a [dropdown-divider].

parameters.name: align
parameters.description: Alignment of the dropdown menu.

examples.code:
[jumbotron]

Hello, World!

[lead] This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information. [/lead] [/jumbotron]

examples.note: Set the fluid flag to make a fluid jumbotron.
examples.code:
[jumbotron fluid]

Hello, World!

[lead] This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information. [/lead] [/jumbotron]

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Flag whether jumbotron should be fluid.

items.title: List Group
items.note: Remember that [list-group] must wrap a set of links or list items inserted via the WordPress editor.

examples.code:
[list-group]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
  • Vestibulum at eros
[/list-group]

examples.note: Create a linked list by wrapping links
examples.code: [list-group] Cras justo odio [active]Dapibus ac facilisis in[/active] Morbi leo risus Porta ac consectetur ac [disabled]Vestibulum at eros[/disabled] [/list-group]

examples.note: Wrap items in the list-item shortcode to give them contextual styles
examples.code: [list-group] [list-item type="success"]Cras justo odio[/list-item] [list-item type="info"]Dapibus ac facilisis in[/list-item] [list-item type="warning"]Morbi leo risus[/list-item] [list-item type="danger"]Porta ac consectetur ac[/list-item] [/list-group]

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the list-item.

items.title: Navs
items.note: Remember that [nav] must wrap a set of links and list items inserted via the WordPress editor.

examples.code:
[nav]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/nav]

examples.note: Set the inline flag to make an inline nav.
examples.code:
[nav inline]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/nav]

examples.note: Set the tabs flag to make an tab-styled nav.
examples.code:
[nav tabs]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/nav]

examples.note: Set the pills flag to make an pills-styled nav.
examples.code:
[nav pills]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/nav]

examples.note: Pills-styled navs can also be stacked with the stacked flag.
examples.code:
[nav pills stacked]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/nav]

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Flag whether nav should be inline.

parameters.name: tabs
parameters.description: Flag whether nav should be styled as tabs.

parameters.name: pills
parameters.description: Flag whether nav should be styled as pills.

parameters.name: stacked
parameters.description: Flag whether nav should be stacked.

items.title: Pagination
items.note: Remember that [pagination] must wrap a set of list items and links inserted via the WordPress editor.

examples.code:
[pagination]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/pagination]

[pagination size="lg"]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/pagination]

[pagination size="sm"]
  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/pagination]

[pagination]
  • [active]Cras justo odio[/active]
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • [disabled]Morbi leo risus[/disabled]
  • Porta ac consectetur ac
[/pagination]

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Optional size of the pagination.

items.title: Popovers
items.note: Wrap any element in a the [popover] shortcode to give it a popover. This may not work well on all elements depending on styling and other factors.

examples.code: [popover title="Popover title" content="Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus." ]Cras justo odio[/popover]

examples.note: Use the focus trigger to dismiss popovers on the next click that the user makes.
examples.code: [popover trigger="focus" title="Popover title" content="Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus." ]Cras justo odio[/popover]

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the popover.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the popover.

parameters.name: placement
parameters.description: Placement of the popover.

parameters.name: trigger
parameters.description: The popover trigger (use focus to dismiss popover on next click).

examples.note: Use the striped flag to produce a striped progress bar.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the progress bar.

parameters.name: striped
parameters.description: Flag whether progress bar should be striped.

parameters.name: animated
parameters.description: Flag whether progress bar should be animated.

items.title: Tooltips
items.note: Wrap any element in a the [tooltip] shortcode to give it a tooltip. This may not work well on all elements depending on styling and other factors.

examples.note: Use the html flag to allow HTML in the tooltip

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The content of the tooltip.

parameters.name: placement
parameters.description: Placement of the tooltip.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: Flag whether content should be parsed for HTML.
